Uses of Class
org.azeckoski.reflectutils.ClassFields

Packages that use ClassFields
org.azeckoski.reflectutils A set of reflection utilities and miscellaneous utilities related to working with classes and their fields with no dependencies which is compatible with java 1.5 and generics. 
 

Uses of ClassFields in org.azeckoski.reflectutils
 

Fields in org.azeckoski.reflectutils with type parameters of type ClassFields
protected  Map<Class<?>,ClassFields> ClassDataCacher.reflectionCache
           
 

Methods in org.azeckoski.reflectutils that return ClassFields
<T> ClassFields<T>
ReflectUtils.analyzeClass(Class<T> beanClass)
          Analyze a class and produce an object which contains information about it and its fields
<T> ClassFields<T>
FieldUtils.analyzeClass(Class<T> cls)
          Analyze a class and produce an object which contains information about it and its fields
<T> ClassFields<T>
FieldUtils.analyzeObject(Object obj)
          Analyze an object and produce an object which contains information about it and its fields
<T> ClassFields<T>
ClassDataCacher.getClassFields(Class<T> cls)
          Get the class fields analysis of a class which contains information about that class and its fields, includes annotations, fields/properties, etc. packaged in a way which makes the data easy to get to, use the ClassData object to get to the more raw data
<T> ClassFields<T>
ClassDataCacher.getClassFieldsFromObject(Object obj)
          Convenience Method:
Analyze an object and produce an object which contains information about it and its fields, see ClassDataCacher.getClassData(Class)
 

Methods in org.azeckoski.reflectutils that return types with arguments of type ClassFields
protected  Map<Class<?>,ClassFields> ClassDataCacher.getReflectionCache()
           
 

Method parameters in org.azeckoski.reflectutils with type arguments of type ClassFields
 void ReflectUtils.setReflectionCache(Map<Class<?>,ClassFields> reflectionCache)
          Set the cache to be used for holding the reflection data, this allows control over where the reflection caches are stored, this should store the data in a way that it will not hold open the classloader the class comes from
Note that you can set this to a map implementation which does not store anything to disable caching if you like
 void ClassDataCacher.setReflectionCache(Map<Class<?>,ClassFields> reflectionCache)
          Set the cache to be used for holding the reflection data, this allows control over where the reflection caches are stored, this should store the data in a way that it will not hold open the classloader the class comes from
Note that you can set this to a map implementation which does not store anything to disable caching if you like
 

Constructor parameters in org.azeckoski.reflectutils with type arguments of type ClassFields
ClassDataCacher(ClassFields.FieldFindMode fieldFindMode, Map<Class<?>,ClassFields> reflectionCache)
          Construct and specify the field finding mode and your own cache when caching class data, must implement the standard map interface but only the following methods are required:
Map.clear(), Map.size(), Map.put(Object, Object), Map.get(Object)

WARNING: if you don't need this control then just use the ClassDataCacher.getInstance() method to get this
ReflectUtils(ClassFields.FieldFindMode fieldFindMode, Map<Class<?>,ClassFields> reflectionCache, Resolver resolver, Map<Class<?>,Converter<?>> converters)
          Create a new copy of the reflection utilities so you can control various things like the field finding mode and the caching
WARNING: This is expensive and recreating it over and over is not a good idea, you should use the static instance if you are not prepared to cache this object somewhere
Use ReflectUtils.getInstance() to avoid recreating this over and over
